skill.name: code-review
skill.description: Perform code reviews following Sentry engineering practices. Use when reviewing pull requests, examining code changes, or providing feedback on code quality. Covers security, performance, testing, and design review.

skill.author: getsentry

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure markdown prompt file with no executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution. The content provides legitimate code review guidelines matching its stated purpose.

content.user_title: Review code with engineering best practices
content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss security vulnerabilities, performance issues, or design problems. This skill provides systematic guidelines to identify common issues across Python, Django, TypeScript, and React while maintaining constructive feedback.
actual_capabilities: Identify runtime errors like null pointer exceptions and out-of-bounds access
Detect performance issues including N+1 queries and unbounded operations
Review code for security vulnerabilities such as injection and XSS
Evaluate test coverage for business logic and edge cases
Assess architectural design and component interactions
Provide constructive feedback following engineering best practices
limitations: Does not execute or test code directly
Requires user to provide code context and diffs
Does not access version control systems automatically
Focused on guidelines rather than automated analysis

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Systematically evaluate code changes for quality, security, and maintainability before merging

use_cases.title: Assess design decisions
use_cases.description: Review architectural impact, component interactions, and long-term technical debt implications

use_cases.title: Verify test coverage
use_cases.description: Ensure new code includes appropriate tests for business logic and critical user paths

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code diff for security vulnerabilities. Look for injection risks, access control gaps, and secrets exposure.

prompt_templates.title: Performance review
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for performance issues. Flag N+1 queries, unbounded operations, and unnecessary allocations.

prompt_templates.title: Full code assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete code review covering runtime errors, security, performance, design, and test coverage. Provide actionable feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Test evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate the test coverage for this PR. Verify tests cover requirements and edge cases. Flag missing or inadequate tests.

output_examples.input: Review this Python function for security and performance issues
output: Security: Potential SQL injection on line 42 - use parameterized queries
Performance: N+1 query detected in loop - prefetch related data
Design: Consider adding type hints for better maintainability
Tests: Missing edge case test for empty input scenario

best_practices: Provide actionable suggestions rather than vague criticism
Approve when only minor issues remain - avoid blocking for stylistic preferences
Flag complex changes like schema modifications for senior engineer review
anti_patterns: Blocking PRs for personal stylistic preferences
Using harsh or dismissive language in review comments
Approving without verifying test coverage for new functionality

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for code review tasks.

faq.question: What types of code can be reviewed?
faq.answer: Covers Python, Django, TypeScript, and React with language-specific patterns.

faq.question: Does this integrate with GitHub or GitLab?
faq.answer: No - provide code diffs or snippets directly in your prompt for review.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes - this is a prompt-only skill. Code is processed by your AI tool and never stored externally.

faq.question: Can this run automated tests?
faq.answer: No - this skill provides review guidelines. Tests must be run separately.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax and style issues. This skill identifies design, architecture, and logic problems.
